free_text.Learning outcomes: To learn the main techniques for analyzing and for designing[br/]algorithms, while building a repertory of basic algorithmic solutions[br/]to problems in graph theory, linear algebra, geometry, biology,[br/]scheduling, and finance.
free_text.Content: [br/]Algorithm analysis techniques: worst-case and amortized,[br/]average-case, randomized, competitive. Basic algorithm design[br/]techniques: greedy, iterative, incremental, divide-and-conquer,[br/]dynamic programming, and randomization.
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic data structures (arrays, lists, stacks, queues,[br/]trees) and algorithms (binary search; sorting; graph connectivity);[br/]basic discrete mathematics (proof methods, induction, enumeration and[br/]counting, graphs); data abstraction.

en.title: Advanced algorithms
en.library_recommends:
• "Algebraic complexity theory / Peter Bürgisser, Michael Clausen, M. Amin Shokrollahi ; with the collab. of Thomas Lickteig". Year:1997. ISBN:3-540-60582-7
  • "Approximation algorithms / Vijay V. Vazirani". Year:2003. ISBN:3-540-65367-8
  • "Computational complexity / Christos H. Papadimitriou". Year:1996. ISBN:0-201-53082-1
  • "Quantum computation and quantum information / Michael A. Nielsen and Isaac L. Chuang". Year:2003. ISBN:0-521-63235-8
  • "Randomized algorithms / Rajeev Motwani, Prabhakar Raghavan". Year:1995. ISBN:0-521-47465-5

free_text.Contenu: Algorithm analysis techniques: worst-case and amortized,[br/]average-case, randomized, competitive. Basic algorithm design[br/]techniques: greedy, iterative, incremental, divide-and-conquer,[br/]dynamic programming, and randomization.
free_text.Prérequis: Basic data structures (arrays, lists, stacks, queues,[br/]trees) and algorithms (binary search; sorting; graph connectivity);[br/]basic discrete mathematics (proof methods, induction, enumeration and counting, graphs); data abstraction.
